original_text: responses.Note that we use the word “organization”
suggested_edit: responses. Note that we use the word “organization”
rationale: Missing space after a period violates readability and general style conventions; AP and Bellwether require one space after sentences.

original_text: To express our gratitude for your participation, all participants who provide contact information will receive a summary of survey responses.Note that we use the word “organization” throughout the survey rather than “CMO” or “network” given the range of governance structures used by CMOs and related entities to operate schools.
suggested_edit: To express our gratitude for your participation, all participants who provide contact information will receive a summary of survey responses. Note that we use the word “organization” throughout the survey rather than “CMO” or “network,” given the range of governance structures used by CMOs and related entities to operate schools.
rationale: Adds needed period and comma after a closing quotation per AP; fixes run-on and ensures clarity.

issue: Unnecessary capitalization and inconsistent punctuation around abbreviations
original_text: Foundation for Excellence in Education (“ExcelinEd”) and the National Alliance of Public Charter Schools (NAPCS).
suggested_edit: Foundation for Excellence in Education (ExcelinEd) and the National Alliance of Public Charter Schools (NAPCS).
rationale: AP and Bellwether do not use quotation marks around abbreviations in parentheses; parentheses alone suffice.

original_text: pre-K through grade #
suggested_edit: pre-K through grade [number]
rationale: Avoid the hash symbol; write out as a word or provide a blank for a number to maintain professionalism and clarity.

issue: Parallelism and clarity in Q3 option
original_text: Functional Lead in charge of expansion (e.g., Chief Growth Officer or Expansion Project Manager)
suggested_edit: Functional lead in charge of expansion (e.g., chief growth officer or expansion project manager)
rationale: Use sentence case for generic job titles per AP; ensures parallel style with other options.

original_text: does your organization operate its schools?(please select all that apply)
suggested_edit: does your organization operate its schools? (Please select all that apply.)
rationale: Add space after question mark and capitalize sentence start inside parentheses; add closing period for complete parenthetical sentence.

original_text: Northeast (NY, CT, RI, MA, VT, NH, ME)
suggested_edit: Northeast (CT, MA, ME, NH, NY, RI, VT)
rationale: Optional: Alphabetize state abbreviations within regions for readability and consistency.

issue: Capitalization and clarity for government program names
original_text: title and other federal funding, categorical aids (transportation, library services, pre-K, etc.)
suggested_edit: Title I and other federal funding, categorical aids (transportation, library services, pre-K, etc.)
rationale: If referring to Title I, capitalize and specify for accuracy. If not, consider rephrasing. Flagging for clarity.

original_text: (please provide approximate maximum and minimum values across all schools)
suggested_edit: (Please provide approximate maximum and minimum values across all schools.)
rationale: Capitalize the first word in a standalone parenthetical sentence and add a period.

original_text: broaden and/or deepen impact
suggested_edit: broaden or deepen impact
rationale: Avoid “and/or” for clarity; use “or” when either or both are acceptable, or specify as needed.

original_text: If so, how? (check all that apply)
suggested_edit: If so, how? (Check all that apply.)
rationale: Capitalize the first word in parenthetical instruction and end with a period for consistency.

original_text: Disseminate our practices to other educators through... [please explain]
suggested_edit: Share our practices with other educators through… [Please explain]
rationale: Use people-first, plain language (“share” vs. “disseminate”); fix ellipsis style and capitalize instruction.

original_text: expand to operate schools in a new state in which your schools do not currently enroll students?
suggested_edit: expand to operate schools in a state where you do not currently enroll students?
rationale: Streamlines phrasing while preserving meaning; follows concise Bellwether tone.

original_text: within the next...
suggested_edit: within the next:
rationale: Replace informal ellipsis with a colon to introduce the list of time frames.

original_text: NA (we do not anticipate being willing to expand to a new state)
suggested_edit: N/A (We do not anticipate being willing to expand to a new state.)
rationale: Use standard abbreviation “N/A”; capitalize first word in parenthetical sentence and add period.

original_text: No, and we don't intend to develop a target
suggested_edit: No, and we do not intend to develop a target
rationale: Avoid contractions in formal survey language.

original_text: We seek to grow at a rapid pace and flexible about all growth conditions.
suggested_edit: We seek to grow at a rapid pace and are flexible about all growth conditions.
rationale: Add missing verb for grammatical agreement; ensures parallel structure.

original_text: foreseeable future, but would consider
suggested_edit: foreseeable future but would consider
rationale: No comma needed before a simple coordinating conjunction when the second clause is not independent.

original_text: pace/staffing conditions
suggested_edit: pace and staffing conditions
rationale: Bellwether style advises avoiding forward slashes unless truly needed; replace with words.

original_text: region?(select all that apply)
suggested_edit: region? (Select all that apply.)
rationale: Add space after question mark, capitalize instruction, and add period.

original_text: under performing private school
suggested_edit: underperforming private school
rationale: Correct compound word per style: “underperforming” is one word.

original_text: with full human capital autonomy
suggested_edit: with full autonomy over human capital (hiring, staffing, and compensation)
rationale: Clarifies potentially vague jargon and improves readability for respondents.

original_text: 301-1000 miles (within the same broad geographic region of the US)
suggested_edit: 301-1,000 miles (within the same broad geographic region of the U.S.)
rationale: Add comma in thousands and periods in U.S. per AP style.

original_text: Not applicable
suggested_edit: Not applicable (N/A)
rationale: Optional: Provide standard abbreviation for consistency with other items using N/A.

original_text: ELL status
suggested_edit: EL status
rationale: Bellwether prefers “English learners (ELs)” over “ELLs”; use EL thereafter.

original_text: Not at all Important / Unimportant / Neither Important nor Unimportant / Important / Extremely Important
suggested_edit: Not at all important / Unimportant / Neither important nor unimportant / Important / Extremely important
rationale: Capitalize only the first word or use sentence case for options for consistency; AP style does not capitalize common nouns mid-sentence.

original_text: Minimum public $ per student ($k)
suggested_edit: Minimum public funding per student ($000s)
rationale: Avoid using the dollar sign as a noun and unclear “$k.” Spell out the metric for clarity.

original_text: would you most prefer to help your organization to manage facilities costs?
suggested_edit: would you most prefer to help your organization manage facilities costs?
rationale: Remove unnecessary “to” after “help”; improves flow.

original_text: preference around how facilities aid is delivered
suggested_edit: preference for how facilities aid is delivered
rationale: Use “preference for” rather than “preference around” for standard usage.

original_text: Yes; other preference [please explain]
suggested_edit: Yes; other preference [Please explain]
rationale: Capitalize first word in bracketed instruction for consistency.

original_text: Answer If Does your CMO provide transportation in any of your current regions? No Is Selected
suggested_edit: [Logic note: Display this question only if Q24 = No.]
rationale: Remove UI/system artifact language and replace with a concise logic note to avoid respondent confusion.

original_text: Yes; but only if there is a per-pupil allocation for transportation
suggested_edit: Yes, but only if there is a per-pupil allocation for transportation
rationale: A comma, not a semicolon, is appropriate before a coordinating conjunction in a simple sentence.

original_text: geography?(please rank order your top three choices)
suggested_edit: geography? (Please rank your top three choices.)
rationale: Add space, capitalize first word, and tighten instruction phrasing for clarity.

original_text: Local Teach For America corps members / Local Teach For America alumni
suggested_edit: Local Teach For America corps members / Local Teach For America alumni
rationale: Confirm capitalization matches brand style; no change if already correct. Flagging for verification.

original_text: Answer If What is your CMO's position on collective bargaining by school employees?(Select all that apply) Would consider opening schools in a geography that requires collective bargaining Is Selected
suggested_edit: [Logic note: Display Q29 only if Q28 = Yes.]
rationale: Remove system-generated text; replace with clear logic note.

original_text: human capital requirements
suggested_edit: talent requirements
rationale: Bellwether tone favors people-first language; “human capital” can be jargon. Consider using “talent” for accessibility.

original_text: organization's
suggested_edit: organization’s
rationale: Use curly apostrophes for consistency if typographic quotes are used elsewhere; ensure consistency across document.

original_text: local/regional governing board
suggested_edit: local or regional governing board
rationale: Avoid forward slashes unless truly needed; use plain language per Bellwether style.

original_text: Yes (please explain) ____________________
suggested_edit: Yes (please explain): ____________________
rationale: Adds a colon to clearly introduce the write-in prompt; improves readability.

original_text: Engage directly with community members (including potential families) in private or small-group meetings
suggested_edit: Engage directly with community members (including potential families) in private or small group meetings
rationale: Bellwether style avoids unnecessary hyphens; here, "small group" functions as a noun, not a compound modifier before a noun.

original_text: Other 1 / Other 2
suggested_edit: Other (please specify): ______ / Other (please specify): ______
rationale: Clarifies what "Other" means and adds consistent write-in cues; improves respondent usability.

original_text: yet may vary across regions or states.
suggested_edit: and may vary across regions or states.
rationale: Replace "yet" with "and" for neutral, concise tone; avoids informal contrast.

original_text: organization's
suggested_edit: organization’s
rationale: Replace HTML entity with proper apostrophe for readability and professionalism.

original_text: staff to student ratios
suggested_edit: staff-to-student ratios
rationale: Hyphenate compound modifier before a noun per style guidance.

original_text: teacher and leader compensation and benefit packages
suggested_edit: teacher and leader compensation and benefit packages
rationale: No change needed to nouns; flag removed to avoid false positives.

original_text: Freedom to opt-out of state/local teacher pension system or retirement plan (and choose an appropriate plan)
suggested_edit: Freedom to opt out of the state or local teacher pension system or retirement plan (and choose an appropriate plan)
rationale: Use "opt out" as a verb without a hyphen; avoid forward slash; add articles for clarity.

original_text: Freedom to set an appropriate school culture (including discipline system)
suggested_edit: Freedom to set an appropriate school culture (including the discipline system)
rationale: Add article for clarity and maintain parallel noun phrase.

original_text: organization's
suggested_edit: organization’s
rationale: Fix HTML entity to proper apostrophe for readability.

original_text: Q44 Funding and facilities
suggested_edit: Q44 Funding and Facilities
rationale: Capitalize major words in headings per Bellwether headline style.

original_text: Start-up funds are available in the state—from federal, state, or private sources
suggested_edit: Start-up funds are available in the state — from federal, state, or private sources
rationale: Use spaced em dashes per Bellwether style.

original_text: High performing CMOs
suggested_edit: High-performing CMOs
rationale: Hyphenate compound modifiers before a noun per style guidance.

original_text: State law provides for the automatic closure of chronically low-performing charters.
suggested_edit: State law provides for the automatic closure of chronically low-performing charters
rationale: Within matrix lists, maintain consistent omission of periods at line ends unless full sentences are used throughout. Other rows lack periods.

original_text: organization's
suggested_edit: organization’s
rationale: Replace HTML entity with proper apostrophe.

original_text: Q47  Non-policy factors
suggested_edit: Q47 Non-policy factors
rationale: Use a single space after sentences and headings; remove extra space.

original_text: organization's
suggested_edit: organization’s
rationale: Fix HTML entity to proper apostrophe.

original_text: cost-of-living
suggested_edit: cost of living
rationale: Hyphenate only when used as a modifier before a noun; here it functions as a noun object.

original_text: Poort student performance within current educational options
suggested_edit: Poor student performance within current educational options
rationale: Correct misspelling.

original_text: A specific demographic make-up of the state’s student population
suggested_edit: A specific demographic makeup of the state’s student population
rationale: Use "makeup" as a noun; avoid unnecessary hyphen.

original_text: A specific demographic make-up of regional/local (within the state) student populations
suggested_edit: A specific demographic makeup of regional or local (within the state) student populations
rationale: Use "makeup" as a noun and replace slash with "or" per style.

original_text: current charter and private school market penetration
suggested_edit: current charter and private school market penetration
rationale: No slash present; remove placeholder to avoid confusion.

original_text: setting(s)
suggested_edit: Feasibility of opening schools in rural setting(s)
rationale: Page appears to continue the previous item but only shows a fragment; restoring full phrase improves clarity. If this is a formatting artifact, confirm source file.

original_text: Note that this contact information is linked with your response; your survey data will no longer be anonymous to our research team but will absolutely remain confidential for any and all reporting purposes.
suggested_edit: Note that this contact information is linked with your response. Your survey data will no longer be anonymous to our research team but will remain confidential for all reporting purposes.
rationale: Breaks a long sentence for readability; removes intensifier "absolutely" per concise tone.

original_text: the “>>” button below
suggested_edit: the ">>" button below
rationale: Use straight quotation marks around UI text for consistency with survey formatting.

original_text: Note that this email will not be linked to your response data.
suggested_edit: This email will not be linked to your response data.
rationale: Remove "Note that" per Bellwether guidance to avoid throat-clearing and improve concision.
